intro: Olyra capillata, commonly known as the slender olyra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has slender, erect stems covered in fine, hair-like structures. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a dense cluster, and the leaves are narrow and linear. Olyra capillata is often found in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
